page.title: 05Staploe, Buildings
page.content: In addition to the priory refectory, Bushmead Estate contains a group of interesting buildings. The 1700 redbrick house, adjoining the refectory, incorporates Priory remains. The Coach House nearby, also 18th Century, is a former timbered barn with redbrick infill. Most unusual, is the Grotto, reputedly an 18th century Observatory, 3 storeyed, with battlemented corner turrets, a pyramid roof and a small flint grotto. Duloe has an 18th Century former public house "The Anchor", 2-room plan thatched cottages and a redbrick 18th Century Dovecote with weatherboarded lantern or glover.Staploe has a weatherboarded 18th Century cottage in the main-street and a 17th Century timber-framed farmhouse at its western end. Chestnuts Farm and Goodwick Farm at Honeydon are 17th Century.
